headline: Ali Khamenei, Iran's supreme leader and symbol of a  repressive regime, has died
description: The successor to Ayatollah Khomeini in 1989, Ali Khamenei embodied the Islamic Republic, setting its political course both domestically and abroad. Over the course of his rule, and faced with the country's isolation, he chose to harden the regime and brutally repress any dissent. He died on Saturday, February 28, at the age of 86.

headline: Iran's state media say 100 killed in strike on girls' school
description: Footage broadcast by state media shows the rubble of a girls' school in Minab where 108 people were reportedly killed, according to Iranian press reports. Tehran has accused the United States and Israel of an 'atrocious crime.'

headline: Israel rallies in national unity to support attack on Iran
description: Ahead of October parliamentary elections, on Saturday, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's opponents voiced their support for the US-Israel joint operation against Iran's regime. Israeli public opinion was also ready for a new offensive.

headline: Israeli first responders confirm first fatality since Iran began launching missiles
description: On Saturday, Israel confirmed its first fatality since Iran began launching missiles earlier in the day in response to a wave of US-Israeli attacks. Throughout the evening, journalists reported loud blasts around Jerusalem, Tel Aviv and the occupied West Bank.

headline: Trump gives in to the temptation of regime change in Iran with Operation Epic Fury
description: The American president, in coordination with Israel, has embarked on a war with an unpredictable duration. This runs counter to his promises to the MAGA movement, which has opposed any prolonged military engagement abroad.

Rwanda: Claude Muhayimana sentenced on appeal to 14 years in prison for complicity in genocide
description: The Paris criminal court sentenced the former street sweeper from Rouen to 14 years in prison for transporting militiamen to various massacre sites in April 1994.

headline: How Paris is turning into 'Frollywood,' a refuge for American actors
description: Whether George Clooney, Matt Dillon or Kristen Stewart, France is attracting more and more actors from across the Atlantic. This trend speaks to both the Trump-era crisis and the decline of the Hollywood model.

headline: Ukraine: 'The war could still last for years and paradoxically, time is not on the Kremlin's side'
description: Researcher Dimitri Minic tells Le Monde in an interview that it is 'too soon to write off Ukraine,' even though the balance of power currently favors Russia.
